cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with fault tolerance in distributed systems, which is a topic that falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses security guarantees against Byzantine adversaries, which is a topic that falls under the category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). The use of proof-of-work (PoW) is a key component of the proposed solution, which is a topic that falls under the category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The reduction in group size and its impact on communication and state costs is a topic that falls under the category of Information Theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper deals with the design of attack-resistant algorithms, which is a topic that falls under the category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
